Question:
The soles of weightlifting shoes are designed to be ______, aiding the lifter when under heavy loads. 
A) extremely flexible 
B) soft and cushioned 
C) quite rigid 
D) thin and sensitive

Which of the following lifts was NOT one of the competition lifts at the 1920 Olympic Games? 
A) 'One hand' snatch 
B) 'Two hands' clean and jerk 
C) 'Two hands' press 
D) 'One hand' clean and jerk

What is the main benefit of the sleeve rotation on an Olympic barbell? 
A) Increases the weight of the bar 
B) Enhances the grip strength 
C) Reduces the rotational inertia of the bar 
D) Makes the bar more flexible

According to the color designation, which of the following pairs of plate weights share the same color?
A) 1 kg and 5 kg
B) 1.5 kg and 15 kg
C) 2 kg and 2.5 kg
D) 0.5 kg and 10 kg

What is the weight of a men's Olympic barbell? 
A) 15 kg 
B) 20 kg 
C) 25 kg 
D) 44 kg
